title: To buy or to rent? That is the question
summary: Buying a home is typically the biggest and most complicated financial commitment we will ever make. And home ownership is a riskier proposition for households compared with renting.
content:
Street Sign Buy versus Rent

BUYING a home is typically the biggest and most complicated financial commitment we will ever make. And home ownership is a riskier proposition for households compared with renting.

Buyers take on enormous debts, sign multi-year loan agreements and become responsible for the cost of maintaining their homes. Renters, on the other hand, have to consider both market conditions and

title: Falling property prices - a boon for buyers
summary: Real estate prices are never easy to predict thanks to their periodically unexpected fluctuations. Once a shining example for South-East Asian property investors, Malaysia’s property market has seen its fair share of fluctuations these past years.
content:
Real estate prices are never easy to predict thanks to their periodically unexpected fluctuations. Once a shining example for South-East Asian property investors, Malaysia’s property market has seen its fair share of fluctuations these past years.

Some regions have shown a decline while others are continuing to thrive. Making informed decisions as an investor requires a thorough understanding of the factors driving such spikes

title: Grey neighbourhoods: fit for the ageing
summary: Malaysia’s population is beginning to age. Our South-East Asian nation is undoubtedly experiencing rapid ageing thanks to its growing segment of elderly individuals.
content:
Malaysia’s population is beginning to age. Our South-East Asian nation is undoubtedly experiencing rapid ageing thanks to its growing segment of elderly individuals.

This phenomenon is much more pronounced in urban areas, where younger people have migrated away in search of greener pastures in large cities or overseas. As such, these neighbourhoods have experienced a constant decline in their younger population, leaving behind

title: Selangor hopes Budget 2025 will provide allocation to empower E&E industry, flood mitigation, logistics
summary: The Selangor government hopes that Budget 2025 to be tabled by the Federal Government can provide an impetus in the allocation for the empowerment of the electrical and electronics (E&E) industry, flood mitigation and logistics in the state.
content:
SHAH ALAM (Oct 5): The Selangor government hopes that Budget 2025 to be tabled by the Federal Government can provide an impetus in the allocation for the empowerment of the electrical and electronics (E&E) industry, flood mitigation and logistics in the state.

Menteri Besar Datuk Seri Amirudin Shari said the financial impetus was necessary in line with the aggressive measures taken by his administration in developing the semiconductor industry in Selangor.

title: S P Setia launches Atlas Melbourne mixed development project in Melbourne's CBD
summary: S P Setia Bhd (KL:SPSETIA) has officially launched its latest Australian project, Atlas Melbourne, at a preview event held at the Setia International Centre in KL Eco City on Saturday.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Oct 5): S P Setia Bhd (KL:SPSETIA) has officially launched its latest Australian project, Atlas Melbourne, at a preview event held at the Setia International Centre in KL Eco City on Saturday.

Located on 383 La Trobe Street in Melbourne's central business district (CBD) and occupying 2,850 sq m of prime freehold land, Atlas Melbourne is a 73-storey mixed-use development comprising one residential tower atop a podium that houses gro

title: Dzulkefly: Number of oncologists in Malaysia to reach 400 by 2040
summary:
The number of oncologists in Malaysia is expected to increase to 400 by 2040, up from the current 175, said Health Minister Datuk Seri Dr Dzulkefly Ahmad.

He stated that this target can be achieved with Malaysia’s participation in the Fellowship of the Royal College of Radiologists (FRCR) in Clinical Oncology.
content:
PUTRAJAYA (Oct 5): The number of oncologists in Malaysia is expected to increase to 400 by 2040, up from the current 175, said Health Minister Datuk Seri Dr Dzulkefly Ahmad.

He stated that this target can be achieved with Malaysia’s participation in the Fellowship of the Royal College of Radiologists (FRCR) in Clinical Oncology.

"The National Cancer Institute (IKN) will continue to be a centre of excellence and participate in the FRCR.

title: Fadillah: Govt to expand cancer centre network in Malaysia
summary:
The government is working to expand the network of cancer centres in Malaysia, Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Fadillah Yusof said.

He said two new centres will be established as part of this initiative — the Northern Region Cancer Centre in Kedah and the Sarawak Cancer Centre in Kota Samarahan, Sarawak.
content:
PUTRAJAYA (Oct 5): The government is working to expand the network of cancer centres in Malaysia, Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Fadillah Yusof said.

He said two new centres will be established as part of this initiative — the Northern Region Cancer Centre in Kedah and the Sarawak Cancer Centre in Kota Samarahan, Sarawak.

"This is a significant step towards ensuring that quality cancer treatment is accessible to the public, regardless of geographical location,

title: Energy Ministry kicks off open bidding of renewable energy certificates generated this year
summary: Open bidding of renewable energy certificates (RECs) generated this year through the Malaysia Green Attribute Trading System (mGATS) platform will take place from the seventh to the 11th of every month, until all the RECs offered have been fully acquired.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Oct 5): Open bidding of renewable energy certificates (RECs) generated this year through the Malaysia Green Attribute Trading System (mGATS) platform will take place from the seventh to the 11th of every month, until all the RECs offered have been fully acquired.

“In tandem to the increasing demand for REC generated in year 2024, a total of 1,000 GWh hydro REC and 100 GWh solar REC will be open for bidding from 12pm on Oct 7 to 5pm on Oct 11, 2024,” said the Ministry of Energy Transition and Wate

title: Ringgit seen holding steady against US dollar next week
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The ringgit is expected to linger around at 4.21 to 4.22 against the US dollar next week but with an upside bias for the greenback after Friday’s US non-farm payrolls (NFP) unexpectedly rose sharply by 254,000 jobs in September.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The ringgit is expected to linger around at 4.21 to 4.22 against the US dollar next week but with an upside bias for the greenback after Friday’s US non-farm payrolls (NFP) unexpectedly rose sharply by 254,000 jobs in September.

Bank Muamalat Malaysia Bhd chief economist Dr Mohd Afzanizam Abdul Rashid said the stronger-than-expected US jobs reading is likely to further enhance the appeal of the American dollar.

"The US Federal Reserve (Fed) may resort to

title: Boustead Properties launches Mutiara X Super App
summary:
Boustead Properties Bhd, under its Mutiara Spaces brand, has launched a new mobile app — Mutiara X Super App — on Thursday.

The app serves as a digital platform that consolidates Mutiara Spaces’ offerings into one touchpoint. It provides customers with access to exclusive rewards, extra privileges and a seamless experience across lifestyle, property and reward programmes.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Oct 5): Boustead Properties Bhd, under its Mutiara Spaces brand, has launched a new mobile app — Mutiara X Super App — on Thursday.

The app serves as a digital platform that consolidates Mutiara Spaces’ offerings into one touchpoint. It provides customers with access to exclusive rewards, extra privileges and a seamless experience across lifestyle, property and reward programmes.

“Today, we are excited to unveil a digital milestone that signifies a

title: Anwar: Budget 2025 to address inflation, boost wages
summary: The Madani government will address the issue of inflation in Budget 2025, which will be tabled on Oct 18, Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim said.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Oct 5): The Madani government will address the issue of inflation in Budget 2025, which will be tabled on Oct 18, Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim said.

Anwar noted that while the prices of goods such as edible oil, petrol and flour are relatively cheaper in Malaysia compared to regional peers, there remains a need to focus on improving income levels.

“The level of income has not increased, (amid) an increase in productivity or investments.

title: The Week Ahead: Central banks’ monetary policy decisions, inflation data in focus
summary: Over at The Reserve Bank of Australia, the minutes for its September policy meeting will be released on Tuesday.
content:
Attention will be on the monetary policy decisions of central banks across several regions this week, as well as inflation data in several important economies.

Across the Causeway, of interest is the Monetary Authority of Singapore’s (MAS) Monetary Policy Statement (MPS) and whether its release date will coincide with the Ministry of Trade and Industry’s issuance of the advance third-quarter (3Q) gross domestic product (GDP) data.

title: Anwar: Ringgit’s recent rise beneficial for Malaysia, but yet to reach fair value
summary: The ringgit has yet to reach its fair value despite its recent rise against the US dollar and emerging as Southeast Asia’s best-performing currency, said Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Oct 5): The ringgit has yet to reach its fair value despite its recent rise against the US dollar and emerging as Southeast Asia’s best-performing currency, said Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim.

“It is still undervalued (even) at RM4.10 per US dollar. People know it used to be RM3.80, but it is wise for it to strengthen gradually without intervention.

“Let the market forces play. This would reflect confidence in government policies and how

title: Double cover: Taxing issues for palm oil sector + Maybank making good headway towards key targets despite challenges
summary: Although the palm oil sector has been the backbone of the Malaysian economy for over five decades, in recent years it has been beset by a myriad of problems, from rising production costs to stagnating yields to labour shortages.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Oct 5): Although the palm oil sector has been the backbone of the Malaysian economy for over five decades, in recent years it has been beset by a myriad of problems, from rising production costs to stagnating yields to labour shortages.

Against this backdrop, the industry has been lobbying for a review of the windfall profit levy (WPL) that is imposed on oil palm growers.

Plantation and Commodities Minister Datuk Seri Johari Abdul Ghani has also pr

title: 'Khazanah, EPF to stay dominant after MAHB takeover'
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Global Infrastructure Partners is not expected to interfere with the daily operations of Malaysia Airports Holdings Bhd (MAHB) after acquiring a 30 per cent stake in it together with Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA), an analyst said.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Global Infrastructure Partners is not expected to interfere with the daily operations of Malaysia Airports Holdings Bhd (MAHB) after acquiring a 30 per cent stake in it together with Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA), an analyst said.

Khazanah Nasional Bhd and the Employees Provident Fund (EPF) will continue to play a significant role in MAHB's operations and strategic decisions as they still hold the majority stake.

Economic analyst Dr Mohamad Khair Afham said this includes strategic decisions such

title: Malaysia's energy stocks soar amid Middle East tensions
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia’s energy stocks surged on Friday, driven by a sustained rally in oil prices amid escalating concerns over tensions in the Middle East.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia's energy stocks surged on Friday, driven by a sustained rally in oil prices amid escalating concerns over tensions in the Middle East.

The Bursa Malaysia Energy Index gained 4.07 per cent or 34.87 points to close at 892.68 points.

Several major oil and gas services firms saw hefty increases in their share prices.

Hengyuan Refining Company Bhd surged 23.40 per cent or 55 sen to RM2.60, while Dayang Enterprise Holdings Bhd rose 9.87 per cent or 22 sen to RM2.45.

Hibiscus Petroleum Bhd

title: Wall St Week Ahead: Investors look to earnings to support stocks
summary: A high-stakes corporate earnings season kicks into gear next week, with bullish investors hoping results will justify increasingly rich valuations in a US stock market near record highs.
content:
Companies need to post healthy profit growth and strong outlooks for next year to sustain valuations that have crept up in recent months. — Reuters

NEW YORK: A high-stakes corporate earnings season kicks into gear next week, with bullish investors hoping results will justify increasingly rich valuations in a US stock market near record highs.

title: Oil posts biggest weekly gains in over a year
summary: Oil prices rose on Friday and settled with their biggest weekly gains in over a year on the mounting threat of a region-wide war in the Middle East, although gains were limited as US President Joe Biden discouraged Israel from targeting Iranian oil facilities.
content:
Brent crude futures rose 43 cents, or 0.6%, to settle at US$78.05 per barrel, while US West Texas Intermediate crude futures gained 67 cents, or 0.9%, to close at US$74.38 per barrel.

title: Dow ends at record high on easing economic worries
summary: The Dow posted a record closing high on Friday and the Nasdaq ended with a more than 1% gain as a stronger-than-expected jobs report reassured investors who had worried the economy may be getting too weak.
content:
The Dow rose 341.16 points, or 0.81%, to 42,352.75, the S&P 500 gained 51.13 points, or 0.90%, to 5,751.07 and the Nasdaq added 219.37 points, or 1.22%, to 18,137.85.

NEW YORK: The Dow posted a record closing high on Friday and the Nasdaq ended with a more than 1% gain as a stronger-than-expected jobs report reassured investors who had worried the economy may be getting too weak.

US job gains increase

title: 13 contractors receive acceptance letters for Phase 1B of Pan Borneo Highway project
summary:
A total of 13 contractors on Friday received their letters of acceptance (SST) to carry out Phase 1B of the Pan Borneo Highway (LPB) project in Sabah. 

Works Minister Datuk Seri Alexander Nanta Linggi officiated the SST handover ceremony at the Sabah International Convention Centre here.
content:
KOTA KINABALU (Oct 5): A total of 13 contractors on Friday received their letters of acceptance (SST) to carry out Phase 1B of the Pan Borneo Highway (LPB) project in Sabah. 

Works Minister Datuk Seri Alexander Nanta Linggi officiated the SST handover ceremony at the Sabah International Convention Centre here. Also present was Sabah Deputy Chief Minister III Datuk Shahelmey Yahya, who is also the state works minister.

Nanta told reporters after the ceremony

title: Sarawak Premier leads list of 1,376 recipients of Sabah state honours
summary: Sarawak Premier Tan Sri Abang Johari Tun Openg leads the list of 1,376 recipients of Sabah state honours, decorations and medals in conjunction with the 71st official birthday celebration of the Yang Dipertua Negeri Sabah, Tun Juhar Mahiruddin on Saturday.
content:
KOTA KINABALU (Oct 5): Sarawak Premier Tan Sri Abang Johari Tun Openg leads the list of 1,376 recipients of Sabah state honours, decorations and medals in conjunction with the 71st official birthday celebration of the Yang Dipertua Negeri Sabah, Tun Juhar Mahiruddin on Saturday.

Abang Johari is one of the four recipients of the Seri Panglima Darjah Kinabalu (SPDK), the highest state honour of Sabah, which carries the title "Datuk Seri Panglima."

title: It’s looking up for the ringgit
summary: The ringgit’s fierce charge from the bottom rung to the top of the world currency chart has silenced the naysayers for now.
content:
THE ringgit’s fierce charge from the bottom rung to the top of the world currency chart has silenced the naysayers for now.

At the height of the ringgit’s weakness, many predicted it would be a matter of time before one US dollar equalled RM5.

title: Much hinges on US polls
summary: The next one month could be crucial for financial markets and economies across the world. The outcome of the US presidential election will likely have major implications for years. And the big gains made by the ringgit and local equity market could be at risk should Donald Trump win on Nov 5.
content:
The next one month could be crucial for financial markets and economies across the world. The outcome of the US presidential election will likely have major implications for years. And the big gains made by the ringgit and local equity market could be at risk should Donald Trump win on Nov 5.

The race is too close to call at present as both candidates still have time to win over voters. Both the Republican and Democratic Party

title: Finding value in rare prints
summary: Books have value. The global market for rare collectable books – including prints, maps and manuscripts – was estimated to be worth US$1.6bil in 2022, according to data by the Rare Book Hub.
content:
Rare book dealers like Crouch (left) will be participating in Firsts Hong Kong. — Daniel Crouch Rare Books

BOOKS have value. The global market for rare collectable books – including prints, maps and manuscripts – was estimated to be worth US$1.6bil in 2022, according to data by the Rare Book Hub.

title: Higher wages is the solution
summary: The average Malaysian is struggling with cost of living issues, compounded by slower growth of median household income and continued rise in spending on basic necessities.
content:
THE average Malaysian is struggling with cost of living issues, compounded by slower growth of median household income and continued rise in spending on basic necessities.

The findings in the fifth edition of Khazanah Research Institute’s State of Households report for 2019 to 2022, released last week, are not new. Many households have been burdened by inflation that has far outstripped wage increases since the economy reopene

summary: Affordable living quarters has long been a problem in South-East Asia, particularly among young people.
content:
Catering to young renters, the properties feature regular community activities and convenient amenities. — Photo: LiveIn

AFFORDABLE living quarters has long been a problem in South-East Asia, particularly among young people.

title: Cruising making waves
summary: Malaysia is looking to expand its presence in the cruise tourism sector and if all goes according to plan, the segment may well play a pivotal role in Visit Malaysia 2026.
content:
MALAYSIA is looking to expand its presence in the cruise tourism sector and if all goes according to plan, the segment may well play a pivotal role in Visit Malaysia 2026.

summary: THE government’s plan to adopt net disposable income (NDI) as the new basis for measuring poverty is a significant move.
content:
If Padu functions as intended, it could reduce inefficiencies in the current system and enable better decision-making.

THE government’s plan to adopt net disposable income (NDI) as the new basis for measuring poverty is a significant move.

summary: I remember when I saw my first ATM machine decades ago at a shopping centre in Kuala Lumpur.
content:

title: Pragmatic AI and cloud computing policy needed
summary: The government’s national cloud computing policy plan is necessary to regulate artificial intelligence (AI) even though it means adding yet another layer of regulations.
content:
Robot

THE government’s national cloud computing policy plan is necessary to regulate artificial intelligence (AI) even though it means adding yet another layer of regulations.

Chaos will ensue if AI is not regulated. As for cloud computing, there are issues of mandating the localisation of storage and its data protection.

summary: The electric scooter market is growing exponentially globally, fuelled by increasing localisation of production in emerging economies.
content:
Electric two-wheelers are viewed as a cost-effective and eco-friendly mode of transportation. — Ather Energy/Unsplash

THE electric scooter market is growing exponentially globally, fuelled by increasing localisation of production in emerging economies.

title: Gaining ground in the region
summary: The ringgit’s recent strong rise against the US dollar has overshadowed the local note’s performance against regional currencies.
content:
THE ringgit’s recent strong rise against the US dollar has overshadowed the local note’s performance against regional currencies.

If one has visited a money changer recently while travelling abroad, then the fact that the ringgit has been able to purchase more of its neighbours’ currencies, especially since February, would not have escaped even the most mundane traveller.

title: Reversing the downward spiral
summary: China's 5% growth in the first half of the year may seem solid but key indicators show deeper challenges, signalling potential risks ahead. In fact, the economy has been on a gradual decline since the second quarter.
content:
CHINA’S 5% growth in the first half of the year may seem solid but key indicators show deeper challenges, signalling potential risks ahead. In fact, the economy has been on a gradual decline since the second quarter.

Money supply or M1 growth decelerated to a record low of 7.3%, pointing to extremely weak domestic demand.

title: Managing unrealistic expectations
summary: As an investor, what do you expect when you hire an independent financial adviser?
content:
AS an investor, what do you expect when you hire an independent financial adviser?

Do you expect them to consistently deliver returns every year for all your investments?

title: Will AI boost growth in Asia?
summary: There is much hype about artificial intelligence (AI) and technology sparking off a revival of growth globally. How far is that true?
content:
Team of programmers

THERE is much hype about artificial intelligence (AI) and technology sparking off a revival of growth globally. How far is that true?

In recent years, growth everywhere has slowed down due to productivity declines, in spite of the Internet and computer revolution.

content:

summary: As global markets face unprecedented challenges and opportunities, several key themes are shaping the investment landscape. In this column, we explore these themes and their implications for investors worldwide.

Malaysian Semiconductor Industry Association president Datuk Seri Wong Siew Hai.

summary: Pestech International Bhd has proposed to undertake a restricted issue of 1.33 billion new shares to Dhaya Maju Infrastructure (Asia) Sdn Bhd at an issue price of 12 sen a share, raising RM160mil in the process.

title: Muhammad Yunus a compassionate human being the world needs — Anwar
summary:
Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim has described the Chief Advisor of Bangladesh's Interim Government, Dr Muhammad Yunus, as a compassionate human being that the world needs.

He said the Nobel laureate had touched the hearts and souls of the marginalised and less fortunate.
content:
DHAKA (Oct 4): Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim has described the Chief Advisor of Bangladesh's Interim Government, Dr Muhammad Yunus, as a compassionate human being that the world needs.

He said the Nobel laureate had touched the hearts and souls of the marginalised and less fortunate.

"I have known you for the past four decades as a person who has taken those initiatives (to help the less fortunate). Your lack of experience in governance they say is not

title: Govt wants more local tech companies to expand their business in Malaysia — Gobind
summary: In the excitement brought about by the surge of foreign investments in Malaysia’s digital economy, the government wants to see more homegrown technology companies “jump on the bandwagon” and expand their businesses in the country, Digital Minister Gobind Singh Deo said.
content:
PUTRAJAYA (Oct 4): In the excitement brought about by the surge of foreign investments in Malaysia’s digital economy, the government wants to see more homegrown technology companies “jump on the bandwagon” and expand their businesses in the country, Digital Minister Gobind Singh Deo said.

He said one of the many efforts undertaken by the government to make that aspiration a reality was the Gateway, Amplify, Invest & Nurture (GAIN) initiative by the Malaysia Digital Economy Corporation (MDEC).
